title: Apple Watch app is useless and iOS app is now worse…
body:
Update as of 7/31/21: Apple Watch app is useless again. Every day when I open the watch app, it says “Logged Out, Log In on your mobile device”. If I have to use the mobile device, the watch app becomes useless. Also, the iOS app is now worse. Every day, the iOS app requires that I sign in regardless of whether I toggle the “Keep Signed In” switch. So every day I have to sign in with my email/password as well as the pin code (the toggle to use Face ID on the pin code screen also times out every day). I’ve reinstalled and no luck. Every app update that comes through, I have anxiety. Will the app be better or worse? 

Update as of 2/27/20: They have put out an update that fixes the problem I listed below. I will leave the description of the problem in case anyone else experiences it but it has now been fixed for me. Changing review to 5 stars.

Let me start by saying that the iPhone app is great. It lets me start/stop/lock/unlock the vehicle with simple FaceID authentication. However, the Apple Watch app (that installs to your watch when you install this iPhone app) is completely useless. If you want to start or unlock your vehicle from the Watch app, you have to pick up your phone, unlock it, find and open your myChevrolet app, and it will ask for your PIN code as soon as it loads. When you put in your PIN code, you can then go back to your watch and use the various functions successfully. Once a few minutes pass (say you went into a store to shop for example), you have to go through that entire process again to perform any functions on the watch. This makes the Watch app completely useless. If I’m required to open the myChevrolet app on my iPhone every time to do any functions on the watch, I will just do those same functions on my phone. I’m already in the app so it’s far quicker to just do them on the phone. There is a setting inside the iPhone app that allows you to “save the PIN code to the Watch” but it has not worked at all for me. I’ve uninstalled and reinstalled the apps numerous times. Maybe it’s a glitch with iOS 13? I’m not sure. But as it stands, the Watch app only takes up space, it doesn’t have a purpose in day to day use. EDIT: Per the developer’s response below, this is the expected operation of the Apple Watch app. Which means that the Apple Watch app is completely useless. If the Apple Watch app requires a pin code due to security concerns (and I understand this) why not ask for the pin code ON THE APPLE WATCH? If I have to open the myChevrolet app on my iPhone each time I want to perform a function that’s available on the Watch app, why in the world would I (or anyone else for that matter) use the Watch app? Especially if I have the cellular Watch model. I feel like there is a problem with their app and the latest WatchOS or iOS 13 or something. I have contacted their support group and was told it was forwarded to the correct team but that was several weeks ago and I haven’t received a single response from them since. I can only give this app a 1 star due to the completely nonfunctional Watch app.

title: $15 A month to use the app.
body:
I get that companies are trying to make money, but I wish they’d be upfront about the cost. 

To save you the hassle I’ve posted the price in this review. 

So for $180 you can have your phone do what your keychain does. 

I’m bummed, because it would’ve been a nice perk…but seems hardly worth it. 

I gave three stars because I couldn’t actually use the app since I didn’t want to pay. It may be worth more or fewer stars, but I guess I’ll never know.

title: Useless app
body: I’m a loyal GM owner and consider myself an early adopter and tech savvy. The old version of this app worked very well and provided what I needed. The new version of the app is horrible and completely unusable. On iOS on a new iPhone 12 the app rarely remains up and running more than 30 seconds at a time. It’s highly unstable and usually takes a dozen or more launches before I can get status of my car. I have restarted the phone multiple times, I have restarted the app repeatedly, I’ve tried logging out and logging back in, and I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app. Nothing will make this app stay open longer that 10-30 seconds. It has become a tragic burden that I can’t use my fancy app with my fancy EV. Please please please GM fix app stability!!

title: It was a trial
body:
If this is a selling point to you for a Chevrolet (or any other GM vehicle), look elsewhere.

This app works without a subscription for 5 years. Which is ridiculous. I spent nearly $40k on this vehicle and am still paying for it, but to have this app and it’s functionality will cost me extra and the subscription price is outrageous. Everything costs something on a monthly basis and none of it is reasonably priced.

That’s absolutely unreasonable and greedy of GM. Fortunately it’s my last GM vehicle because I have had so many issues and continue to do so and GM’s lack of a warranty on much of it tells me they don’t have faith in their own vehicles’ longevity. This just put a nail in the coffin for me.

title: Good features, status indicator would make it great
body:
Pretty cool app. I use it mostly for the remote feature. One option that should be added to make the remote feature more user friendly is to let you know the status of your doors.

Example, let’s say I think I forgot to lock my doors. Sure I can just push to re-lock them, but would be nice if the app displayed that doors were locked. Also, if lights were on.

This would work similar to how the remote start button in the middle will display the time counting down for how long you’ve had vehicle running by remote.

There looks to be space in the center above where the remote start button is located that a status indicator could easily fit.

title: Latest Version Unreliable
body:
Saved logins don’t matter much when the app logs itself out after most updates. This makes the Apple Watch companion app completely worthless. Nothing convenient at all about getting a message to use your phone to logon and select vehicle anytime you try to use. We get this failed 70% or more of the time. 

Focus on reliability, and better UX. A lot of minor issues all around.

title: Bad update
body: Since the update to the app appearance the start button won’t reset after starting the vehicle. It either stays in sent mode or off. I usually have to leave the app open for several minutes before it finally clears out and allows me to start the vehicle. Even if I don’t use the app for several days when I open the app it’s either in sent or off mode, and has to be open for several minutes before resetting. I’ve uninstalled and reinstalled the app only to have it work correctly the first two times before acting up again. I also don’t like the fact that I have to hold the button to operate any of the features of the vehicle, I preferred just having to tap it once to send the message to the vehicle.

title: Will not unlock
body: The app does not let me unlock.

title: Remote Gas Tank levels- feature request
body:
Hey, wouldn’t it be handy to be able to see how full your gas tank is - or isn’t- remotely via this app?

You’d know without having to run out and start the car whether you need to leave early to buy gas. Or if you already had plenty for that big trip. 

You could even set alarms to remind you when it goes below a certain level you can choose. 

Please consider adding this feature. Thanks!

title: Not working
body: Ever since the app was updated it’s hasn’t been working for me I have to delete it then reinstall it almost everyday.

title: 2020 Chevy Trax
body: I currently can’t lock or unlock my car through the app. It either says failed or it is transparent to where I can tap it.

title: Needs Improvement
body: Twice in the last 2 weeks I have tried to unlock my truck via the app as my key fob was not on me. 1 time the lock and unlock buttons were not available (dimmed out) and the other time the unlock button was dimmed but it was locked. Need to have and update or sync button somewhere in the app so things will sync back up and the app know the status of the vehicle. Other than that I love the app and functionality with my truck.

title: Worse after the update
body: I used to love the MyChevrolet App. However, after the most recent update, the app does not work as it should. I have had to reinstall the app multiple times just to lock and unlock my doors. This need is essential when keys happen to get locked into the car. This is something that needs to be corrected, as I am not the only one that is having this issue.

title: Log in/ Apple Watch app
body: I have the leave me logged in enabled but that doesn’t happen. Constantly I have to keep logging into the app. Also what’s the point of having an Apple Watch app with remote features if you can’t even use the app. Tells me to log in and select a vehicle. I do this and it works for a few hours and then I have to select a vehicle again… mostly the main reason I bought an Apple Watch was to not have my phone on me and I can remote start my truck.

title: Good app but having difficulties
body: All of a sudden every time I try to use the lock or unlock feature it says the truck is already unlocked so I can’t unlock the truck and the truck info won’t update it just tries updating forever and never updates. I don’t know hat to fix this.

title: Troublesome app
body:
Twice in as many weeks I’ve had to delete and reload the app. First to rectify the unlock button that would not work and kept saying it was unlocked. Second the app would not start nor unlock my 2019 Silverado. 
The old app was never a problem.

title: Keep Crashing if your system language was not English
body: Keep Crashing if your system language was not English, there are no way to open this app.

title: Requires constant deleting and reloading
body: The app after its major update that changes the face of the app home screen has resulted it no longer functioning. I have to delete and redownload the app in order to lock and unlock my truck. Extremely poor app support as well.

title: It's aiight

title: Can't use remote start

It will let me lick and unlock but it does nothing when I press and hold the remote start. It used to work just fine until a week ago, so I know it's not user error.

title: Unreliable

title: No longer opening!!
body: This app was working a month ago and since last week it just clocks with 3 dots bouncing up and down.

title: 21st Century should work better

FYI - 256gb iPhone 11 Pro Max so it’s not the phone. We just can’t seem to get technology up to current,  much less ahead!

title: Multiple Issues

title: Horrible since last upgrade
body: Why must you continually mess with stuff that works. I have do delete and reload my app everytime i want to use it since the last upgrade. Keep up that great work.

title: App not working since update.
body: Apple Watch will not unlock truck unless app is open on my phone. Major issue when you lock your keys and phone in the truck and watch will not function. Used to work flawlessly now it is junk.

title: Don’t work!!!

title: The update made the app worse

If my car is to far from the house to use, or when leaving work, I can’t start the car in the parking garage. Not happy at all. Last time I I had issues I couldn’t start the car from the app in the winter.

title: Used to be good
body: This app was amazing when it worked right. The redesign was even great. But with the newest update, it’s just a black screen for me now. Reinstalling doesn’t work, no way to log out, and even my Apple Watch complication and app don’t work anymore.

title: Very disappointed
body: The latest version of this app updated and now it requires me to have an Onstar service to use the remote key features.  Really Chevrolet??? I had this free since I purchased my Silverado in 2016 and now you require me to have an Onstar subscription!

title: Great app
body: Update……. I’ve always love this app and then as my review says things changed I was not able to start my car without having to hold the button in for up to five minutes. Now it only happens within seconds! I am very happy with it again. Thank you for the adjustment. The only thing different now is I am not able to lock or unlock my car using the app anymore .. i’m hoping that changes. I am changing the one star rating to a four star rating :) I got this app back in 2018 when I purchased my vehicle and I absolutely loved it and raved about it. About a month ago when you guys did the new update, it takes forever for you to hold the button to get it started. There’s times I have to hold it for up to 5 minutes before it will start rather than just tapping it like before. I hope this changes

title: Not working

title: Newer is not better

title: Very buggy

title: Doesn’t work
body: I really wanted this app to work right.  It constantly informs me that I have a diagnostic issue based on something plugged into my  port.  I’ve never had anything plugged into the port.  It does not track my charge mileage although it’s supposed I get two dash marks where the mileage is supposed to show. I’ve spent hours on the phone with GM and On Star where they have tried and failed to fix these problems over the last three months.  The issues have been elevated to level 3 in the technical group.  Nothing ever improves and the feedback is crickets.  I’m sorry it doesn’t work for me but if I could have rated it 0 stars I would have.  Tomorrow I cancel On Star.

title: Fob controls gone
body: Was working fine up until a few weeks ago. Now just shows “shop accessories” over where the fob controls would normally be. I cannot get to the fob controls. Fix your app.

title: Elimination of movement arrow on vehicle locate
body: Why did you do that? It was a very informative and step saving feature. Now it’s gone.

title: Different look but much slower

I used to almost be able to watch a vehicle turn by turn but now it is 15+ seconds between updates.. is this normal?  Just curious if this is the new norm for this.. thanks!

title: Good App when it works
body: I have had to delete and re-install the app multiple times. Because the remote start feature stops working, the Face ID stops working or it constantly logs me out.

title: Great app…when it works
body: Depending on this app for quick remote starts from either my phone or watch is futile. I find it crashed just about every time I try to open it. This leads to forgotten PIN and password and deactivated FaceID. And makes it totally useless on my watch. I’ve used it over the last few years on 2 or 3 different iPhones with 3 different Chevy vehicles. Same behavior from the start.

title: Not working
body: App worked fine then suddenly nothing.  It shows my car locked and the unlock feature doesn’t work.  App is not being fixed.  Frustrating since I pay for this every month.

title: No Longer Works
body: All of the functions minus shipping for accessories have stopped working.

title: Inconsistent and unreliable
body: This app doesn’t work all the time. Opening it takes forever. I should have the option to turn off the passcode. I already have a passcode for my phone. I don’t need a passcode for this app. It takes forever to get into it to start my truck. Also there is no widget. Why not. Single button to start my truck right in my widget screen…yes please. Smart locks for my home have widgets, why not Chevy? The watch app is completely broken. It never works. Hasn’t worked since day one. It’s a shame too because that would be the best. This app is just really bad. Lots of other apps that can do the same things that do it way better. The UI is not good either. It would be super easy to put all the buttons on one screen. 😂🤣 but you have to hit “more” to get to the last 2 buttons. Also a status update telling you if your vehicle is unlocked or locked or running or off would be great. And why is there no Siri integration? This is just a bad app. I paid for a year but unless it gets some serious attention, I will not pay again. You can do better Chevy. Ram did……🤷‍♂️

title: App does not always work

I am paying for this service and it seems like 30% of the time it does not work!  
Several times the app would not unlock my doors.  Today it will not start my truck.  
What am I paying for?!

title: Not real handy
body:
The old version was okay, but the new version the unlock feature is now disabled.
Pretty useless if you can’t use the phone to unlock your truck if you don’t have your keys handy!

title: Does not work

After I do that it spins and spins just to send me back to the login page and have to do it all again and keep getting the same results. I have both my phone and the app fully up to date. I’ve deleted the app and reinstalled it, but I shouldn’t have to do this to be able to use the app.

title: App is total trash
body: I’ve had this app for years since the recent update it does not work. I know I’ll get the standard response and I’ve already read all the other reviews. Yes I’ve deleted and reinstalled. Now every time I try to add my vehicle it freezes and I have to log back into it. This is typical of Chevrolet and the overall service I’ve received over too many years. My next vehicle purchases will not be with GM so help me god.

title: App not working

Every since I got my new iPhone 12 plus, this app doesn’t work anymore. I’ve deleted the app and still won’t work.

Update: I did something (don’t ask)and it is now working. Customer service did reach out to me to rectify the issue but it is resolved. I love this app because I have control over my vehicles where every they are!

title: Stay Logged In Does Not Work Rendering Apple Watch App Useless
body: The stay logged in setting for the app does not work.  The switch is toggled but every time I try to use the app, it wants the OnStar password.   And because of this, the Apple Watch App no longer works as the watch instructs you to login on your phone.  The previous version of this app used to retain the stay logged in setting.   Please fix this.

title: Problem with remote start
body:
App has been great for a long time now. I like the new dashboard layout. I especially like that the button to start the car now has the new glow so that you can see that it is activating.
However, a bug was introduced in the latest rev that the button stays at displaying “Sent” after you use it once. Even after driving. Even after restarting the app. 
So now it is a start once only, until the next app update... 
I’m hoping this gets fixed soon, but otherwise it’s a great app and deserves 5 stars.

Update:
Don’t know why, but after my review I tried logging out and closing the app. Initially I had just restarted my phone and the app. Logging out worked. Something reset during the login? 
Anyway it’s working perfectly now!
Update from 4 stars to 5 on this great app.

title: Need help. App doesn’t work.

title: Horrible Design!!!!
body: This app is terrible. You would think a big company like Chevrolet would put more effort into their app. It’s so bad, I’ve just deleted it. It’s not worth the frustration. So disappointed that with all this technology built into my new truck, they can’t create an app to work with the vehicle. So bad it has me rethinking buying another Chevrolet in the future. That’s hard to say for a die hard Chevy fan, but I feel this strongly about how awful this app is!!

title: Bad update
body: The app has worked perfectly from day one. However the last time I updated the app it caused the remote start button to be stuck in the truck off position. When that happens it makes it impossible to start the truck. Need a new update to fix the issue.

title: App is not as good as it was.
body: I used to like the app. I used it to check status and especially liked the remote start in cold weather.  It’s response time was pretty good.   Now, most of the time, it fails to connect. The fix is to start car to reconnect. If you are using the locate function to find the car, that would be a little hard. I don’t know why the app went down hill so much, but the nicer graphics are no replacement for poor reliability.

title: Very Disappointed
body:
Since the last update I have had nothing but issues. I have to reinstall the app four times because it eventually will get stuck on the last command. Once it gets stuck I cannot do anything except uninstall. It also keeps asking me to enable biometric even though it is already enabled. 

I am a new Chevy owner and probably will not purchase this service after my free trial is up. To much of a headache. 

Two stars only because when the app is not glitching I do like the features.

title: Aggravating!
body: Since the recent “updates” this app works horribly! I continuously have to delete and reinstall the app for it to work, if that’s what you would call working. When I open the app to lock or unlock my vehicle the function is ghosted so you can’t even select it to use. I cannot imagine what this scenario would look like if I was having an emergency! The original version worked perfectly fine for me without any hiccups.

title: Not reliable
body: The older version was better than this new one. Never works properly. Garbage. Not even a way to send feedback.

title: They ruined the app
body: I loved the old app. All you had to do is just push a button and move on to lock/unlock or start your car. Now you have to sit there and hold it. Second thing is and I've tried reaching out to them to get help on this issue but I'll open the app and it says "off" on the button to start the car. Since they haven't been helpful with this I have had to delete the app and add it again and login and everything. I hate it this app. I just want to be able to push the button and go about my business and not have to sit there and hold the button down and wait to see if it was "sent"

title: Fancy looking garbage
body: I’m honestly about to cancel the whole OnStar deal and delete the app because it’s worthless. They have a box that you can check to “keep me logged in” for 365 days, but every time I open the app I have to login again and then use my passcode only to have to login again. It’s like a weird loop. Once you’re logged in everything is good, but it makes the watch experience useless because literally every time I open the watch app it tells me I need to login with my phone and have to have my phone and it needs my phone for something. So… Why do I have a watch with cellular and can go without my phone and even pay for purchases but this app needs my phone and forces me to login constantly? I liked the older version when this problem didn’t exist.

title: Can’t get status
body:
In app, click vehicle status and get page where I can schedule service but it does NOT show me my vehicle status. Nothing about recalls (which there are a bunch on 2021 Tahoe), can’t see tire pressure, can’t see oil level. No status.

After working with GM’s Social Media Support Team I have realized that this app is only good for 2 things: to schedule maintenance and to have GM try to sell you OnStar services or accessories.  Don’t bother, it is not worth the hassle.

title: June update issues

The lock button seems to be locked or stuck and doesn’t actually allow me to lock my vehicle when it is unlocked. The unlocked button is grayed out like it isn't an option. 
Very disappointed in this features malfunction.

so I gave one star. 
However, my complaint was responded to and turns out all I had to do was delete and re-download the app 
It works now. 
I think. 
At least I can access it. 
I’ll find out soon enough how well it works

title: REALLY tired of reloading app :/

I would LOVE if you guys could fix this so I don’t have to constantly delete and reload just get my car cooled down before getting into it. C’mon guys, you can do it!!

title: New update killed the app
body: After the June 2021 update I can no longer start my truck. It just says “off” and won’t let me click it. Looking at other recent reviews, it looks like the new update screwed everyone over. No need for me to keep paying a monthly subscription for something that doesn’t work!!

title: Good app when it worked
body: Great app when it works...which it did for a long time.  Two days ago when I tried to use the app to remote start my vehicle, it gave me system failure responses.  I called the OnStar tech who had me delete the app, she re-linked my service, but unfortunately I am now not given any of the options to start, lock, etc. my vehicle.  She said she would create a ticket, but there should be an easier option around this.

title: Horrible user interface.
body: Before the “user requested upgrades” the app was more functional. The app now forces you to enable phone level security access in order for the app to remain logged in with your id. I do not want my phone to be a PIA to open or unlock every time the screen times out. These “security” measures make this app completely even a bigger PIA to use. I almost wouldn’t mind just putting my password in the app every time but the app doesn’t even remember my ID so I have to put my ID and password in every time I want to use the app. Not to mention the 4 digit pass code to send the vehicle request from the app to the vehicle. As with every software update people cringe when they see they must update for fear of loosing features they like for mandates passed down by the tech giants. :(

title: App not opening
body: I had to delete the app but when I tried to reinstall it it won’t open up.

title: When it works, it’s great
body: I have been in a jam twice now and twice this app has failed me. I left my key fob in my car (on purpose) because I was just a few feet away. The doors locked so I thought “I have this app no big deal”. Nope. App failed to load. Today I was at a soccer game and told my daughter to text me when she got to the car and I’d use the app too open the doors. Nope again. App failed to load. I uninstalled it and reinstalled it and now it just keeps saying it’s unable to load my account details. I’ve used the app a few times without a problem. Most of the time I needed all 5 bars and/or wifi to use this app. It stinks and I’m frustrated and I can’t depend on it AT ALL.

title: Getting better

It’s too temperamental.

title: So close to perfect!
body:
What a refresh! The new app is really sharp looking and a welcome facelift to the old, outdated app. The app is moving in the right direction. 

3 things I would add:
I would love to see some options like closing the windows and sunroof. Perhaps the ability to adjust the climate controls. I would like to also see the option to turn off the pin requirements. 

This would really round out the options and make this a world class app like other manufacturers offer!

body:
When this updated app works it provides us with lots of useful information. However, recently on a semi regular basis, it logs us out and we have to sign back in with our email and password. 
And on a much more regular basis since the big update, it reports that it is unable to connect to our 2017 Chevrolet Bolt EV and says to contact On Star support for assistance. When that happens, we get no current information regarding the status of the car. This is very frustrating, especially when we are using the app to monitor the charging status of the Bolt.

title: Love this app!
body: It’s so convenient to start and unlock my car from my phone or watch. I like the new user interface too, it’s easier to use and the start button is much bigger and centered. I wish we didn’t have to hold the buttons to activate them though, I miss just tapping the start button. I hope Chevy adds widgets soon so that you can see your cars gas range, oil life, and the start/unlock features from the iPhone Home Screen though!

title: Hold...keep holding...hold much better now.
body:
Good lord. The redesign is very nice looking. But the functionality is the worst. The old design you tapped on the function, confirmed and the signal was sent. Now you have to hold the function (say the start button) until the signal is sent. You do not have to hold the start function as long. Standing next to the car I had to hold the start button for what seemed 10 seconds. This defeats the purpose. iPhone 12 Pro.
Update: the most recent update has greatly improved the response time and lag that was obvious in the first release of the redesign.

title: Great for basic tasks, still has a lot of work
body: The most recent UI update is great and has really  brought it into modern design. That diagnostic features a cool. And haptic feedback and animations are intentional and intuitive. The additions of the following would make it flawless!!! A graphic of your car on the dashboard. Faster startup and authentication with biometrics. Display the current status: whether it’s currently locked or unlocked, what is on and what is off, if it’s currently in motion or not, doors and windows open or closed, which seats are buckled, has the car alarm been triggered. Car alarm notifications. Ability to see and change current climate settings if remote started: temp, fan speed, heated seats, heated steering wheel, A/C, heat, direction of air, defrosters, wipers. What is there is well refined, useful, and reliable. But the potential this app has can set this app apart from the rest if further developed.

title: Needs fixing
body: The app works ok as far as I can tell. I’ve only explored through the app just to see what it has and to see how things work through the app. Except I have one main issue which is the reason I rated this app ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️. I tried using the vehicle Locate, but for some reason it doesn’t work correctly even if I’m in my vehicle at the time. So I deleted the app twice and it still doesn’t give me the correct place my vehicle is at. I’ve tried it with my vehicle on and with it off. After I go into vehicle locate it shows a little map area that your vehicle is in which that part is showing it correctly, but it doesn’t give you the precise location to where your vehicle is at. It just gives me the area closely around my address, but when you hit the find vehicle it says that my vehicle is in a town not even near me. Like right now it is showing that my vehicle is in Blanco, TX which is actually 1hr 15min away. My vehicle is in my driveway no where near Blanco. Last time it showed that it was even further away out even more hours away. So I called customer service and they told me to try deleting the app and re down loading it and if that didn’t work to call Onstar.  So I deleted it twice and it didn’t work. Then after that didn’t work I called Onstar and told them the issue I was having with the Chevrolet App and what the customer service told me. They checked out my vehicle location from their computer and it showed them where my vehicle was located and it was at the correct address. They also saw that I have the Onstar Guardian app and the location to my vehicle was also at the correct address. They said that I would need to contact Chevrolet customer service and let them know that the issue is coming from their end and that they would need to fix it. So how can this be fixed, cause I’m pretty sure that I can’t be the only one with this issue? If this can be fix then I’ll change it to ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: QoL improvement suggestions
body:
- Add the option to link Owner Center account to the Onstar account from within the app. 
  >  Most people don’t know that this is even a thing until it’s their first time setting it up and see the “Get Connected: Press the Blue Onstar Button to speak to an Advisor now!”. You can create an Owner Center account from so hon the app, you should be able to link it too.

- Ability to update/change PIN within the app.
  >  You used to be able to do it with the old layout. It’s be more convenient than needing to login to the Owner Center. Where’d that option go?

- Make it so “Keep Me Signed In” option is available/possible without needing a Security PIN/Password/TouchID/FaceID on my phone, itself.
  >  A lot of people, myself included, don’t have a password for our phones. It asks for the OnStar PIN anyways when sending Unlock/RemoteStart anyways. Why the extra steps without making it possible to opt out?

title: March 2021 update is terrible
body: The app updated itself from the prior version and all I got was a dark gray screen upon launch. I had to delete the app and reinstall, then go through the setup all over again and even delete and re-add my phone to keypass in the car. The new “dark” motif is pretty ugly, but I guess that is what app developers feel is currently the hip look. Past the main screen you wind up in the dregs of the previous version which makes the user interface inconsistent and confusing. Functionality seems broken in in many ways. I could not get the app to connect to the car unless I was close enough to have a Bluetooth connection - which pretty much negates the point of having the app in the first place. Doing anything over 4G from a distance times out. The app says to start the car and then try again. I did, but it made no difference. I could not get the app to manage my OnStar account or the Wi-Fi hotspot. Again, the app just timed out even after multiple tries. This app transitioned from OK but not great to almost pointless after the recent update. Last of all, upon install the app warns it will sell your info for location based advertising, and supposedly that behavior can be turned off in Settings, however I do not see any option for that in Settings. Be prepared for frustration if you try to use this app. ——————- Update April 8, 2021. I called OnStar to verify my car still is connected and my account is active; it is. The representative had me sign out and back in to the app. After several times signing out and back in, the app began connecting to the car via 4G. The app still seems unreliable, not always connecting. I raised my review from one to three stars now that the app works sometimes. The app user interface is inconsistent and buggy, so two stars off for being hard to use and for the privacy issue. GM should probably scrap this app and start over with a clean sheet of paper for a better design from the ground up. ——— Update April 20, 2021. V 5.0.1 app has not been able to connect to my car over 4G in the last six days. This app is a waste of effort trying to use. Reducing rating.——— Update May 24, 2021 V 5.2.0 app.  Problems connecting to car.  Says to go to car, turn on car and try again.  4G signal is strong where car is parked.  If I could go to the car I would not need the app.

title: App will not open
body:
After the latest update, the app will not open; all I get is a black screen.  Left it running for 30 minutes and nothing.  Finally deleted it.  Chevrolet doesn’t have any answers either; discovered this as my wife’s Tahoe died and as she was troubleshooting it, her doors locked with her keys, phone & our son inside.  Had to call OnStar to remotely unlock the doors.  They had no idea the app wasn’t working either.  Tahoe is in the shop being diagnosed for electrical issues, though that wouldn’t have anything to do with the app not working.  

Hope they decide to do something really soon, before someone actually gets stuck and someone gets hurt because their app doesn’t work.

title: Key fob
body: The app use to be great!! I updated and found the key fob is gone... I depended on the virtual key fob, especially when I’m out with my daughter or I work nights. The fact that I don’t have that anymore is unacceptable. Especially since it’s not on my watch either!! Having that convenience and mind of ease taken away is horrible. So now if I accidentally lock my keys or god forbid my daughter in the car then I will have to waste money and time to get it unlocked  by emergency personnel, triple a, or someone to bring my spare keys. Please fix this issue!! Having that feature on both the phone and watch puts so many individuals and parents minds at ease knowing that they can get to their children or pets in convenient and timely manner.

title: Problem With The Last Update
body:
After the last update to the app, my Trail Blazer identifies a problem and then tells me a device is plugged into the data port that prevents it from checking system info. I checked the terminal and nothing is plugged in. Couldn’t find any other way to report a problem with the app.

After I went to the MyChevrolet webpage and requested vehicle status there, the app started displaying status correctly and the vehicle problem error went away.

Really like the one stop dashboard display of vehicle status instead of scrolling through all the vehicle status options.

title: Functionally useless
body: The Chevy app is a case study relentless mediocrity, and a cautionary tale of the awful things that follow when you let an organization like GM dabble in software. Launch time for the app is best measured in geologic epochs, and this is the function the app performs best. Need to unlock your vehicle? Get comfortable, because that's a process that takes anywhere from 45 seconds to five full minutes, which is in no way an exaggeration. How about a basic function provided by competing automakers' apps, like remote start. Sorry, that feature is only available as a paid service through OnStar. The galactic ineptitude of the team behind this farce should, in a functioning corporation, result in their being escorted from the building to spend their remaining years cooking raccoons under an overpass, but GM seems to be fine with their performance.
